title: ITHAX
content:
ITHAX or ITHAS was the messenger of the Titan-gods. He played a role in the old
        Titanomachia epic attributed to Eumelos but is otherwise unknown.

Hesychius suggests he is Prometheus. However this may simply be based on an
        erroneous etymology linkin ithas with the -etheus portion of the Titan's name. Another writer,
        Ptolemy Hephaestion, names Arke as the messenger of the Titanes. It is quite
        possible that her name was derived from an epithet belonging to Ithax, since arkÃª (the swift) is
        an appropriate Homeric title for a messenger.

Eumelus, Fragment 5 (from Hesychius Lexicon i387) (trans. West, Vol. Greek Epic
          Fragments) (C7th B.C.) : 
        "Ithas : The Titanes' herald, Prometheus. Some write Ithax."
